intro: Astragalus buchtormensis var. pseudobuchtormensis, commonly known as the Buchtorm Astragalus, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces pods that contain small, rounded seeds. This variant is distinguished from the typical form by subtle differences in morphology and habitat preference.
